- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
md builders
"using module ./builders/foo.psm1`nfoo" > ./builders/foo.ps1
'function foo {"Hello"}' > ./builders/foo.psm1
./builders/foo.ps1
```

## Expected behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47745270/99388498-be95a780-28e6-11eb-9d6e-35c6eb42fb7f.png)

```none
PS /home/alex> ./builders/foo.ps1
Hello
```

## Actual behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47745270/99388670-ff8dbc00-28e6-11eb-9920-ba81fe531fd6.png)

The module path '/home/alex/builders/builders/foo.psm1' contains duplicate `builders` entry.
```none
PS /home/alex> ./builders/foo.ps1
./builders/foo.ps1: The specified module '/home/alex/builders/builders/foo.psm1' was not loaded because no valid module file was found in any module directory.
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
PS /home/alex> lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS
Release:        18.04
Codename:       bionic

PS /home/alex> $PSVersionTable

----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0

PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


PS. https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/7424
